text: (offbeat uplifting music)
- So my name is Anne Evans.

I have been with AWS for
about two and a half years,
and currently I am running the Office

of Operations within the
Global Partner Organization.

So the Partner Organization
is where we partner
with consultancies, ISVs,
different types of technology companies,
to accelerate our AWS voice and product.
They have a big client base.
We have a fantastic product.
When we put ourselves together
and we get that power

of three between our partner,
our customer, and ourselves,
then we get some real dynamics
that can really do great things.

I think the biggest
surprise having come out

of one of our partner
organizations was the amount

of opportunity for operations
that there is here,
because it is such a hyper scaler
and it's been growing so quickly
and it's changing all the time,
there's always opportunity to build more.
There's always opportunity to create new,
as well as refine anything that's here.
So I'm new to AWS, I had friends here,
I worked at a partner, but to come inside
and see how the sausage is made

and how much opportunity
is super exciting,

and for an operations person,
this is a great place to be

and to really make an impact
and really make a difference.

There's always chance
outside of your day job

to get involved with all
kinds of affinity groups.
I work with the Women
of Amazon Group, obviously promoting women
and how do we actually make an impact

and make sure that we
understand, there is balance.
I have kids, I have to get my kids off

to school every day and make
sure they're getting up.

But people have this thought
that such a big company

that's so driven is always
gonna be just all encompassing.

And really everybody here
understands that we have families,
we have balance,
Women of Amazon is helping people
to understand that as well.
And that, you know,

there are different
situations for everybody.
And we're aware of that,
and we work with our teams to make sure
that we balance the team,
we balance ourselves,

and make sure everybody
is set up for success.
(upbeat music)
It's gonna be an exciting year all around.
We have a new leader

within our organization
who is really exciting.

We have a bunch of new initiatives
that are really exciting

and are really gonna make
a difference for everybody.
One of the things that I'm involved in
is creating this inclusion ambassadors,

where we need to make sure that
we have included everybody.
I work with Women of Amazon,
but it's way beyond that.
It's everybody.
What does everybody need to be included,
and how do they feel included?
(upbeat music)
